qas.question: How long have Armenians lived in the highlands?
Who founded the first Armenian nation?
How many native Armenians are in Armenia today?
How long have Russians lived in the Armenian Highland?
Who founded the first Iranian nation?
Who did Hayk lead the Russians to victory over?
What is the population of Iran today?
What does the name Hayk mean?

context: Armenians have had a presence in the Armenian Highland <b5_0>for <a0_0>over four thousand years<b5_0/><a0_0/>, since the time when <a1_0><b6_0>Hayk<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the legendary patriarch and founder of the first Armenian nation, led them to victory over <a2_0><b7_0>Bel of Babylon<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Today, with a population of <a3_0><b8_0>3.5 million<b8_0/><a3_0/>, they not only constitute an overwhelming majority in Armenia, but also in the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh. Armenians in the diaspora informally refer to them as Hayastantsis (Հայաստանցի), meaning <a4_0><b9_0>those that are from Armenia<b9_0/><a4_0/> (that is, those born and raised in Armenia). They, as well as the Armenians of Iran and Russia speak the Eastern dialect of the Armenian language. The country itself is secular as a result of Soviet domination, but most of its citizens identify themselves as Apostolic Armenian Christian.
